title: Microteaching and Peer Assessment Training Program for Strengthening Remote Education Teachers' Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics education theory and experience with online learning platforms
context.additional_context: Practice-centered education using VR simulations and mobile apps in a limited technological environment focused on smartphones

learning_goals: Participants can explain seven core teacher roles (e.g., lesson design, technology utilization, instructional strategies, class management) in remote education environments with over 80% accuracy.
Participants can design a one-session remote lesson through microteaching practice and execute/demonstrate it with over 90% fidelity in a VR simulation environment.
Participants can analyze peersâ€™ microteaching videos using a peer assessment rubric and provide at least three specific feedback elements.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
